question: Question_06_(c)
statement:
A CT scanner in a hospital is switched on every morning and switched off
at night. The scanner has a probability $\displaystyle q = 0.001$ of
failure when the technician turns it on in the morning. (Assume that if
it turns on, it will not fail later that day i.e. treat this as a
\textbf{discrete} event. Also assume that failure is independent of age
or history of the machine.)

(c) Use the properties of an infinite geometric series to obtain the
summation formula given in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH103/April_2005/Question_06_(b)}{part
(b)}:

\begin{align*}
\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}kr^{k-1} = \frac{1}{(1-r)^{2}}\end{align*}

for $\displaystyle |r| < 1$.
